content:
• Friday, August 5, 2011
  • CMC

    Commercial Metals (CMC -3.7%) finishes near its lows for the day after Standard & Poor's...

    Commercial Metals (CMC -3.7%) finishes near its lows for the day after Standard & Poor's said late yesterday that it was reviewing the company for a possible downgrade to junk. The ratings agency cited a sluggish market, and also noted concerns over Carl Icahn's growing holdings in the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • CRL

    Shares of Charles River Labs (CRL -3.8%) continue to drift lower after hedge fund Jana Partners...

    Shares of Charles River Labs (CRL -3.8%) continue to drift lower after hedge fund Jana Partners disclosed late yesterday that had it sold 1.8M shares, reducing it's stake to around 4.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • INSG

    3G/4G modem vendor Novatel Wireless (NVTL) falls 27.9% after reporting Q2 results. Revenue of...

    3G/4G modem vendor Novatel Wireless (NVTL) falls 27.9% after reporting Q2 results. Revenue of $118M (+64% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.03 beat consensus by $3.4M and $0.07. However, Q3 EPS guidance of -$0.10 to $0.00 falls short of a $0.01 consensus. Novatel and rival SWIR have been dogged by fears of product commoditization and Asian competition.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • EOG

    EOG Resources (EOG +4%) holds on to gains late in the day, after its Q2 earnings jumped nearly...

    EOG Resources (EOG +4%) holds on to gains late in the day, after its Q2 earnings jumped nearly four-fold on bottom-line gains from ramping up its production of higher-margin oil over natural gas.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum (NASDAQ:SPRD) is up 8.8% after reporting Q2 revenue of $160.2M (+124% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    Spreadtrum (NASDAQ:SPRD) is up 8.8% after reporting Q2 revenue of $160.2M (+124% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.65, beating consensus by $4.8M and $0.11. Q3 revenue guidance of $172M-$178M is above a $165.9M consensus. Spreadtrum claims 50% market share for chipsets supporting the TD-SCDMA standard used for China Mobile's (NYSE:CHL) 3G network.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • HTWR

    HeartWare (HTWR +8%) posted a weaker 2Q, with in-line revenue and a greater-than-anticipated EPS...

    HeartWare (HTWR +8%) posted a weaker 2Q, with in-line revenue and a greater-than-anticipated EPS decline. However, shares are higher after its earnings report showed an increase in heart pump orders, mitigating concerns investors had over the impact a pending FDA panel review would have on top-line sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • WTW

    Though delivering consensus-beating Q2 earnings and lifting the low end of its FY11 guidance...

    Though delivering consensus-beating Q2 earnings and lifting the low end of its FY11 guidance range, Weight Watchers (NYSE:WTW) is down 16.5% today. With shares having doubled in 2011 prior to today's drop, investors were clearly expecting more. Concerns about higher ad spending may also be having an effect. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • BRKS

    Brooks Automation (BRKS +7%) is trading higher after reporting FQ3 revenue that topped...

    Brooks Automation (BRKS +7%) is trading higher after reporting FQ3 revenue that topped estimates, and bouyed by its CEO saying the company's strategic position is well diversified to weather the current downturn in demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • RAX

    Web hosting and cloud services provider Rackspace (RAX -2.8%) is lower after delivering solid Q2...

    Web hosting and cloud services provider Rackspace (RAX -2.8%) is lower after delivering solid Q2 results that featured healthy growth in customers and average revenue per server. Kaufman Bros. is reiterating a Hold, arguing positive trends in IT outsourcing and cloud adoption are baked into Rackspace's shares. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • MHK

    Shares of Mohawk Industries (MHK +3.3%) push higher after the firm clocked an earnings beat...

    Shares of Mohawk Industries (MHK +3.3%) push higher after the firm clocked an earnings beat yesterday. The firm reported Q2 revenue of $1.48B (+5.7% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.95, beating estimates by $3M and $0.02. Third quarter EPS guidance was issued at $0.82-$0.91. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • TI

    Further evidence of logic decoupling from market action today: Telecom Italia (TI) is +13.5% as...

    Further evidence of logic decoupling from market action today: Telecom Italia (TI) is +13.5% as investors applaud the company's confirming of an anemic H2 forecast, overlook its debt (on watch for a downgrade), and ignore the implications of taking a goodwill writedown due to "struggling margins" and a "deteriorating macro outlook."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • ACHV

    Shares of OncoGeneX (OGXI -24.3%) crater after the firm announces two of its drug-development...

    Shares of OncoGeneX (OGXI -24.3%) crater after the firm announces two of its drug-development programs for lung cancer will have delayed results. Interestingly, the share price started falling yesterday in advance of this morning's announcement.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • SD

    Today's just not the day to miss on earnings estimates. SandRidge Energy (SD) reported Q2...

    Today's just not the day to miss on earnings estimates. SandRidge Energy (SD) reported Q2 revenues late yesterday that beat estimates, but its adjusted EPS was only breakeven when analysts' had been expecting a profit of $0.03 per share. The stock's -18% on the report.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • IPSU

    Imperial Sugar (IPSU -56%) implodes after its FQ3 loss widened significantly, as the sugar...

    Imperial Sugar (IPSU -56%) implodes after its FQ3 loss widened significantly, as the sugar processor struggled with high raw sugar costs and low sales volume. Expectations were high that it was capitalizing on soaring sugar futures prices, but poorly executed hedging decimated the quarter, as locked-in contracts left no chance to pass on higher prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • CLGX

    CoreLogic (CLGX -30.1%) shares get hammered today after meeting Q2 estimates but lowering FY11...

    CoreLogic (CLGX -30.1%) shares get hammered today after meeting Q2 estimates but lowering FY11 guidance. The company now projects adjusted revenue for the year to be at the low end of consensus range, while EPS is seen at $0.60 - $0.65, significantly below Street expectations of $1.05.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • SUNEQ

    Shares of MEMC Electronics (WFR -7.4%) sink after Kaufman downgrades the firm to Hold from Buy,...

    Shares of MEMC Electronics (WFR -7.4%) sink after Kaufman downgrades the firm to Hold from Buy, saying it looks for the company to do more than just cut costs - a driver of its earnings beat this week - in order to boost profits. Shares now trade 62% off their 52-week high.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • PACB

    Pacific Biosciences (PACB -29%) takes a big hit despite narrower Q2 losses and better overall...

    Pacific Biosciences (PACB -29%) takes a big hit despite narrower Q2 losses and better overall revenues, due to the fact that most of the quarters gains came from accounting measures, rather than actual profit growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM

  • Reuters reports sources saying the ECB will buy Italian and Spanish sovereign paper if Italian...

    Reuters reports sources saying the ECB will buy Italian and Spanish sovereign paper if Italian PM Berlusconi will commit to specific reforms. The euro is all over the place - first printing all the way down to $1.4056 and now back to $1.4224. U.S. shares are rallying.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • TI

    After falling hard yesterday, Telecom Italia (TI +7.9%) is bouncing back thanks to its 1H...

    After falling hard yesterday, Telecom Italia (TI +7.9%) is bouncing back thanks to its 1H results. Revenue of €14.54B (+10% Y/Y) slightly beat consensus, as did earnings of €1.17B (excluding a €3.18B goodwill charge). The company's reiterating of full-year guidance is sitting well with investors worried about macro troubles. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM
  • GHC

    Shares of Washington Post (WPO +1.8%) gain, despite a Q2 report showing a sharp decline in...

    Shares of Washington Post (WPO +1.8%) gain, despite a Q2 report showing a sharp decline in revenue (-10% Y/Y) and net income (-50% Y/Y). The firm missed analyst estimates on EPS by $0.13, as it struggles to keep enrollment stable in its Kaplan Higher Education business.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • MIPS

    MIPS Technologies (MIPS -30%) gets clobbered after missing FQ4 estimates for a third consecutive...

    MIPS Technologies (MIPS -30%) gets clobbered after missing FQ4 estimates for a third consecutive quarter and reducing its FQ1 outlook. Licensing revenue declined for the fifth straight quarter, down 47% Y/Y. Separately, the company announces the retirement of its CFO Maury Austin.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • DLB

    Dolby (NYSE:DLB) plunges 19.3% after reporting FQ3 revenue of $219M (-5% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.65,...

    Dolby (NYSE:DLB) plunges 19.3% after reporting FQ3 revenue of $219M (-5% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.65, beating consensus by $2.9M and $0.11. FY11 EPS guidance of $2.87-$2.96 is above a $2.60 consensus, and revenue guidance of $930M-$955M mostly beats an average forecast of $931.8M. During its FQ3 CC, the company disclosed its technology won't be included in Windows 8.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • URI

    Shares of United Rentals (URI +3.4%) recover after losing 15% yesterday. The firm announced last...

    Shares of United Rentals (URI +3.4%) recover after losing 15% yesterday. The firm announced last night it will host a conference call today with an analyst to update the company's business and financial performance.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • PYX

    Alliance One International (AOI +8.9%) jumps after reporting FQ1 results largely in-line with...

    Alliance One International (AOI +8.9%) jumps after reporting FQ1 results largely in-line with reduced expectations, but upping its FY12 forecast on an increase in new customers and improved order flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • MLCO

    Casino stocks (BJK -1.8%) are awash in red, but firms stay on a growth track in Macau. According...

    Casino stocks (BJK -1.8%) are awash in red, but firms stay on a growth track in Macau. According to sources, Melco Crown (MPEL -6.3%) plans to raise $400M-$600M in a Hong Kong listing following similar gambits by Wynn (WYNN -1.8%) and Las Vegas Sands (LVS -3.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 2 Comments
  • BLKB

    Shares of Blackbaud (BLKB +14.9%) soar after the firm reports Q2 revenue of $93.4M (+16% Y/Y)...

    Shares of Blackbaud (BLKB +14.9%) soar after the firm reports Q2 revenue of $93.4M (+16% Y/Y) vs. consensus $91.6M, and a non-GAAP EPS of $0.27 (+23% Y/Y) - beating estimates by two cents. The firm also announced it will reward investors with a $50M share buyback and a $0.12/share dividend. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • RST

    Rosetta Stone (NYSE:RST) surges 13.3% after reporting Q2 revenue of $66.7M (+10% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    Rosetta Stone (NYSE:RST) surges 13.3% after reporting Q2 revenue of $66.7M (+10% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.22, beating consensus by $4.5M and $0.23. Demand from international consumers (+58% Y/Y) offset weaker sales to institutions (-1%) and U.S. consumers (-5%). The company expects Q3 revenue of $65M-$70M and EPS of -$0.24 to -$0.05, in-line with consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • NILE

    Online jewelry retailer Blue Nile (NASDAQ:NILE) drops 5.1% after reporting Q2 revenue of $80.5M...

    Online jewelry retailer Blue Nile (NASDAQ:NILE) drops 5.1% after reporting Q2 revenue of $80.5M (+5% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.19, missing consensus by $3.6M and $0.02. The shortfall is blamed on rising diamond/metal prices and weak consumer spending. Blue Nile expects Q3 revenue of $71.5M-$74M and EPS of $0.16-$0.17, below a consensus of $77M and $0.22.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • VIEW

    Cogo Group (COGO -26%) tanks after its Q2 beats on revenue, but comes up far short on its...

    Cogo Group (COGO -26%) tanks after its Q2 beats on revenue, but comes up far short on its bottom-line EPS number due to aggressive marketing expenses. The company also reduces guidance for Q3, now saying it expects non-GAAP EPS of $0.15 - $0.16, below the consensus estimate of $0.24. Separately, Needham downgrades the stock, calling it a "value trap."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • MSFT

    After opening higher on strong Q2 results and healthy revenue guidance, LinkedIn (LNKD -5.2%)...

    After opening higher on strong Q2 results and healthy revenue guidance, LinkedIn (LNKD -5.2%) has reversed course in early trading. Concerns about soft EBITDA guidance might be weighing on shares, as could a downgrade to Underweight by Evercore Partners, which is worried about the end of a share lockup in November. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM

  • Stocks give up knee-jerk early gains and turn lower, with small caps, particularly hard hit. The...

    Stocks give up knee-jerk early gains and turn lower, with small caps, particularly hard hit. The Russell 2000 -2.0%. Analyst reaction to the August 2008 jobs report - which easily could have been written 60 minutes ago - remind not to pay too much (if any) attention to a single number.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • FRO

    Sometimes analysts are so late to the party that no coverage would be better than saying...

    Sometimes analysts are so late to the party that no coverage would be better than saying anything at all. Take shipping titan Frontline (NYSE:FRO): after a monumental decline of nearly 78% since May 2010, Jefferies finally downgrades the company to hold today, and the stock jumps +5.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM | 3 Comments
  • BRCD

    Storage stocks are weak out of the gate following Brocade's (BRCD -24.5%) FQ3 warning. EMC...

    Storage stocks are weak out of the gate following Brocade's (BRCD -24.5%) FQ3 warning. EMC -2.7%. NTAP -4.7%. ELX -1.2%. QLGC -1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • ASEI

    American Science and Engineering (NASDAQ:ASEI) is getting hit after a big miss on its Q2...

    American Science and Engineering (NASDAQ:ASEI) is getting hit after a big miss on its Q2 across-the-board due to lower government-contracted cargo shipments. The company says bookings are down 21% Y/Y, and cutbacks in military spending are likely to continue to negatively impact sales over the near term. Shares -17.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • CF

    CF Industries (NYSE:CF) is indicated to open higher after its Q2 easily beat on a surge in...

    CF Industries (NYSE:CF) is indicated to open higher after its Q2 easily beat on a surge in profits amid a booming farm sector. The company also outlined a plan to deploy $1.5B in capital to several projects that will eliminate bottlenecks, expand production and upgrade capacity for its high-margin nitrogen fertilizer products. Shares +5.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM
  • WEB

    Premarket gainers: WWWW +13%. PCLN +12%. ALU +11%. TI +10%. AIB +8%. KOG +7%. STM +7%. ING +7%....

    Premarket gainers: WWWW +13%. PCLN +12%. ALU +11%. TI +10%. AIB +8%. KOG +7%. STM +7%. ING +7%. SNV +5%. ERIC +5%. HUN +6%. NTT +5%. ABB +4%. SQNS +5%. FRO +5%. RCL +5%. NOK +5%. TKC +5%. BBVA +4%. LNKD +4%. STD +4%. NGB +4%. VE +4%. CTIC +4%. IRE +3%. PUK +3%. AMR +3%. AKS +3%. MT +3%. ARMH +3%. SNDK +3%. RENN +3%. WPPGY +3%. MPEL +2%. LYG +2%. UBS +3%. MGM +3%. RIG +2%. LCC +3%. CRM +3%. ANR +3%. PCX +3%.
    Losers: IPSU -42%. MIPS -25%. CLGX -23%. BRCD -18%. SD -8%. SSN -7%. PACB -4%. AHCI -3%. LPL -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • TTMI

    TTMI Technologies (NASDAQ:TTMI) reports a loss for Q2 after taking an impairment charge of $47M...

    TTMI Technologies (NASDAQ:TTMI) reports a loss for Q2 after taking an impairment charge of $47M related to plant equipment. The firm booked a 9% Y/Y increase in sales to $366M, but looking forward lowers Q3 estimates to an EPS range of $0.32-$0.41 on revenue of $365M-$385M. Shares -8.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM
  • BRCD

    Brocade (NASDAQ:BRCD) is down 16.4% premarket after announcing it expects FQ3 revenue of...

    Brocade (NASDAQ:BRCD) is down 16.4% premarket after announcing it expects FQ3 revenue of $500M-$505M and EPS of $0.08-$0.09, below a consensus of $550.9M and $0.11. The shortfall is blamed on soft demand and inventory reductions. Coming in the wake of weak results from CSCO, JNPR, and RVBD, Brocade's warning will add to fears of an IT spending slowdown.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • APO

    Chuck E. Cheese parent CEC Entertainment (CEC) is set open lower this morning, after Q2 sales...

    Chuck E. Cheese parent CEC Entertainment (CEC) is set open lower this morning, after Q2 sales came up short yesterday. The company blames a weak economy, poor weather and increased competition from certain PG-13 movies for a decline in customer traffic, and lowers FY11 guidance. Shares -10% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • QGEN

    Qiagen (NASDAQ:QGEN) announces it has submitted an approval application to the FDA for its...

    Qiagen (NASDAQ:QGEN) announces it has submitted an approval application to the FDA for its Erbitux treatment for colorectal cancer. The firm says its pipeline of healthcare assays includes a submission in 2012 for an EGFR biomarker test for use with an anticancer medicine for patients with a form of lung cancer. Shares +6.3% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM
  • CREE

    More on Rubicon's Q2: The poor guidance is blamed on a weak LED backlighting market (likely due...

    More on Rubicon's Q2: The poor guidance is blamed on a weak LED backlighting market (likely due to soft TV sales), customer inventories, and declining wafer prices. Analysts covering Cree (NASDAQ:CREE) have been concerned about weak LED pricing for a while, though the magnitude of Rubicon's guidance miss is still likely surprising to some.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • RBCN

    Rubicon Technology (NASDAQ:RBCN), a maker of wafers used in LED chip production, is down 14.1%...

    Rubicon Technology (NASDAQ:RBCN), a maker of wafers used in LED chip production, is down 14.1% premarket after reporting Q2 revenue of $43M (+173% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.59, slightly beating a consensus of $42.8M and $0.58. However, the company expects Q3 revenue of $28M-$34M and EPS of $0.23-$0.30, well below a consensus of $45.4M and $0.52.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM
  • NOK

    Shares of Alcatel-Lucent (ALU) recover from yesterday's 10% drop, and are up 7.1% premarket....

    Shares of Alcatel-Lucent (ALU) recover from yesterday's 10% drop, and are up 7.1% premarket. Analysts say investors have underestimated the value of the firm's patent portfolio they see potentially worth twice the $4.5B Nortel fetched for its own portfolio in bankruptcy court.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:27 AM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) rises 5.9% premarket after reporting revenue of $71.7M (+556% Y/Y) EPS of...

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) rises 5.9% premarket after reporting revenue of $71.7M (+556% Y/Y) EPS of $0.15, beating a consensus of $70.6M and $0.14. The company expects FY12 revenue growth of 40%. Fusion-io also announced the acquisition of IO Turbine, whose caching solutions for servers should complement Fusion-io's memory subsystems.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM
  • RBS

    Royal Bank of Scotland (NYSE:RBS) shares are back to near-flat in London after falling more than...

    Royal Bank of Scotland (NYSE:RBS) shares are back to near-flat in London after falling more than 20% earlier on a weak earnings report mixed with the overall stock panic. The ADRs, +1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 AM
  • BKNG

    Priceline (PCLN) is up 9% premarket after reporting Q2 revenue of $1.1B (+44% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    Priceline (PCLN) is up 9% premarket after reporting Q2 revenue of $1.1B (+44% Y/Y) and EPS of $5.49, beating a consensus of $1.07B and $4.87. Q3 revenue growth guidance of 37-42% beats a consensus of 35.9%, and EPS guidance of $9.10-$9.30 beats a $7.94 consensus. J.P. Morgan is reiterating a Buy and lifting its PT to $682. (.pdf) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:30 AM
  • PG

    Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG): FQ4 EPS of $0.84 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $20.9B (+10.2% Y/Y)...

    Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG): FQ4 EPS of $0.84 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $20.9B (+10.2% Y/Y) beats by $270M. Sees FY12 EPS of $4.17-4.33; 1Q12 EPS of $1.00-1.04. Shares -1.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:20 AM

  • European shares are in the midst of a furious bounce off of steep early losses. A sampling:...

    European shares are in the midst of a furious bounce off of steep early losses. A sampling: Italy +2% after being -3.7%, France flat after being -3%, Stoxx 50 flat after being -3.3%. The usual rumors about a ban on short selling and ECB buying of Italian paper float about.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:43 AM | 1 Comment

  • No surprises from the European open, with markets following Asia and the U.S. way, way down....

    No surprises from the European open, with markets following Asia and the U.S. way, way down. London -3.5%. Paris -1.4%. Frankfurt -3.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 AM
  • RBS

    RBS (NYSE:RBS) H1: Net loss of £1.43B ($2.33B) misses by £859M. Revenue -7.6% (Y/Y)...

    RBS (NYSE:RBS) H1: Net loss of 1.43B ($2.33B) misses by 859M. Revenue -7.6% (Y/Y) to 14.34B. Takes 733M impairment on Greek government bonds, 850M provision for missold insurance. (PR .pdf). Shares -11.4% in London trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 AM | 1 Comment

  • Yesterday's plunge in U.S. markets sparks heavy Asian selling, with Europe likely to follow...

    Yesterday's plunge in U.S. markets sparks heavy Asian selling, with Europe likely to follow suit. Japan -3.7%. Hong Kong -5.0%. China -1.7%. India -3.2%. 
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 AM | 2 Comments
